snippet: Guardrails sold by Trinity Industries have been at the center of safety concerns raised by other states, including Missouri and Massachusetts.
abstract: Concern is mounting over safety of guardrails sold by Trinity Industries, as Virginia threatens to stop buying them, and will consider removing them unless manufacturer performs new tests; firm's guardrails have been at center of safety concerns raised by other states, including Missouri and Massachusetts.

byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: Guardrails sold by Trinity Industries have been at the center of safety concerns raised by other states, including Missouri and Massachusetts.

headline.main: Virginia Threatens to Remove Guardrails Unless Manufacturer Performs New Tests
headline.print_headline: Virginia Threatens to Remove Guardrails Unless Manufacturer Performs New Tests
